message_1: If we consider the predicate "P(x) = x + 3 > 5", what is the truth value of P(2)?
message_2:
To find the truth value of P(2), we need to substitute x with 2 in the predicate P(x) = x + 3 > 5.

P(2) = 2 + 3 > 5
P(2) = 5 > 5

Since 5 is not greater than 5, the statement is false. Therefore, the truth value of P(2) is False.
